title: Domain-Specific Modeling (DSM) Intensive Course for Visual Instructional Design Language (VIDLs) Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of mathematical concepts and experience with digital tool applications
context.additional_context: Acquiring visual language development methodologies applicable to mathematics education design. Conducted as microlearning in mobile environments, with continuous monitoring of learning outcomes through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can create simple visual instructional design language (VIDLs) prototypes using the domain-specific modeling (DSM) approach.
Learners can analyze and improve VIDLs models that visually represent mathematical concepts.
Learners can visually design the structure and flow of educational content using graphic editing tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
